S8.T1.caption: TABLE I: System Parameters
references:
In this section, we evaluate the effectiveness of the proposed meta-IoT system.
Specifically, we first provide simulation results for the optimal meta-IoT structure obtained by AlgorithmÂ 1.
Then, we provide the experimental results for the multi-antenna wireless transceiver to validate its capability of sensing meta-IoT sensor arrays at different heights.
Following that, we provide the experimental results for the prototype system to detect and locate humidity and temperature anomalies, in the cases of different measuring distances, anomaly scales, noise levels, and depths of the neural network.
The detailed parameters of the system are summarized in TableÂ I.

Then, the evaluation of the optimal meta-IoT structure obtained by AlgorithmÂ 1 is provided.
Specifically, when solving AlgorithmÂ 1, the same system parameters used in the experimental evaluation in TableÂ I are adopted.
Besides, the additional parameters in the simulation can be explained as follows.

S8.T2.caption: TABLE II: Comparison of the proposed system with existing works
references:
As a summary, we compare the proposed system with the existing works mentioned in SectionÂ II which use passive chipless sensors working in a similar frequency band and having similar functions.
The comparison results are shown in TableÂ II, where the sensitivity is defined by the deviation of the minimum reflected coefficient for a unit environmental condition change, i.e., for 1âˆ˜superscript11^{\circ}C temperature or 1%percent11\% humidity.
From TableÂ II, the following three conclusions can be made.
